results.title: The Greeks in search of meaning
results.creator_credit: Helen Jean Secondari and John H. Secondari
results.brief_description: Recreates the concerns and achievements of the Greeks in the 5th century B.C. Eternal philosophical and moral debates are dramatised through the dialogues of the era’s great thinkers. Includes excerpts from Antigone by Sophocles, and Lysistrata by Aristophanes.

results.title: Greek children
results.brief_description: Daily activities of a boy and girl in Galaxidi, a fishing village in southern Greece; chores of the girl and other womenfolk, the boy’s friendship with the village Shepard who teaches him to play the flute; the boy and his father travel to Athens in an old fishing boat; views of the Acropolis.

results.title: Greece the immortal land
results.creator_credit: Basil Wright, Gladys Wright and Realist Films
results.brief_description: An evocative documentary showing Greece as the background to western civilisation. The artistic treasures of antiquity are seen side by side with the life of the sturdy people today. Contains many spectacular shots of the Parthenon, the ruins of Mistra and Mycenae and the sunbaked landscape along with candid camera sequences of the Greeks of today. Independently financed, this film aroused lively critical comment in Great Britain.

results.title: The Great toy robbery
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Hale, Robert Verrall, Tom Daly, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated spoof of the wild west movies starring the world’s most wanted good guy, Santa Claus, and three hard riding, gun-toting, bad guys. As in all formula westerns, good guys win over evil, but not before robbers and robbed have romped through some incongruous, though recognizable situations. (Awards include: New York, Belgrade)

results.title: Great Plan problems
results.brief_description: Shows the Backby community school complex at Vasteras, Sweden, which is famous throughout Sweden as a particularly well-planned design. It also shows how the early hopes for the school have not been attained because of certain failures of communication between the school and the community it serves. An analysis of the failure is a feature of the film

results.title: The Great Plains
results.creator_credit: Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the prairie region of Canada, showing the varied occupations of farmers and townsmen throughout the year. Prepared primarily for classroom use, the film employs live photography, animation, and in the historical sequences, painting to tell the story of the plains from early days of settlement to such recent developments as the oil industry.

results.title: The Great Mill race
results.creator_credit: Robin Crichton and Edinburgh Film Productions
results.brief_description: An unusual look at the Scottish woollen industry. A fictional race is organised between a number of mills to produce a tweed suit in record time. Follows the race from sheep-shearing to finished article.
results.description: An unusual look at the Scottish woollen industry. A fictional race is organised between a number of mills to produce a tweed suit in record time. Follows the race from sheep-shearing to finished article.

results.title: Great Lakes: Highway to commerce
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the importance of the Great Lakes to the early settlements of America and to the industrial development of regions adjacent to them, Illustrates the role of the Lakes in transporting lumber, wheat, coal, and iron ore; and pictures typical fright carrying vessels. Emphasizes the significance of the Lakes to the prosperity of America and to the well being of her people.
